intro: Jacquinia obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has lanceolate to obovate leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Jacquinia obovata is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
